answers.answer: It sounds like you are having recurrent yeast infections.  A couple of things come to mind 1) You are not entirely eradicating the infection.  You may be resistant to the Monistat & should talk to your doctor about another form of treatment. 2) Recurrent yeast infections happen in people with diabetes.  I think you should be tested. Good luck.

have you been to the dr. if this has been happening for months maybe its time to have a professional, like a gyn, take a look. it might be something that can be cured with some antibiotics.def. have it checked out

Also, if you are in a committed relationship and having sex withthe same person you are just passing it back and forth (also can happen if someone is using toys and not disinfecting them properly)  Need to get to the gyno and figure out the problem--it could be more serious tahn yeast and a  BV infection.

YES I HAVE BEEN TO THE DOCTOR BUT MY TEST KEEP COMING UP WITH NOTHING WRONG AND EVERYTIME IT FLARES UP I SHOW HER BUT SHE SAYS ITS JUST IRRITATED STOP USING CERTAIN THINGS BUT I KNOW THAT SOMETHING IS JUST NOT RIGHT! AND YES I DO HAVE THE SAME SEX PARTNER BUT WHEN THIS HAPPEN WE CAN'T HAVE SEX BECAUSE IT'S TO PAINFUL! SO I REALLY DON'T KNOW WHAT TO DO!

Look up info on vulvodynia, chronic yeast.It is possible to have a low level yeast infection going on with negative cultures, KOH preps and slides. Over 50% of those tests are negative even though the woman suffers from a current infection.Try a pain vulvar pain clinic or call around for a gyn that works with troublesome vaginitis.  Don't keep treating yourself until you find out what's going on. Using otc yeast meds will more than likely lesson any chances of a positive culture.An aside, please don't type with every letter capitalized. It makes things difficult to read.

i have the same problem, i always get yeast infections but this time i had no discharge so the doctor gave me cream for dry skin, which down there can be dry, sore and itchy. the cream works great, it cleared up in 2 days.
You know what it is hard to read now that i look at thanks for letting me know. and thanks to every one who commented on my ?

girl, i definately know where u r coming from. I have had this problem for a year now. What helps me for a little while ( about 2 months) is a pill called "diflucan" which i take just 1 and my BF takes 1. Maybe it will help you more than it did to me. Good luck, i hope we can find a cure for this thing.

question: OK I'VE BEEN HAVING THE SAME PROBLEM FOR MONTHS AND I NEED HELP! AT FIRST I THOUGHT IT WAS A YEAST INFECTION BECAUSE I WOULD GET EVERY SYMPTOM OF A YEAST INFECTION, BUT NOW I DON'T GET THE DISCHARGE ANYMORE I ONLY GET THE ITCHING, BURNING, SORENESS, AND THE IRRITATION REALLY BAD. I USE MONISTAT AND IT GOES ANYWAY BUT THE NEXT MONTH ITS THE SAME THING I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO DO PLEASE HELP!!!!!!!ASAP
title: SAME THING KEEPS HAPPENING! PLEASE HELP ASAP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
